sentence.Network_en: Under conditions of water stress, leaf turgor decreases and stomata close.
sentence.Network_cn: 在干旱的条件下, 叶子的膨压减少而气孔关闭.

sentence.Network_en: Edema tends to appear first where tissue turgor is normally lowest.
sentence.Network_cn: 水肿首先表现在正常时充盈度最低的部位.

sentence.Network_en: Pollen sterile blossoms lack normal turgor.
sentence.Network_cn: 花粉不育的花朵缺乏正常的膨压现象.

...动又可分为两类： ⑴生长运动（growth movement），是不可逆的细胞伸长，如偏上性运动等；⑵紧张性运动（turgor movement），由叶枕膨压变化产生，是可逆性变化，如叶片的感夜运动.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from late Latin, from turgere 'to swell'

means.word_mean: 1. (biology) the normal rigid state of fullness of a cell or blood vessel or capillary resulting from pressure of the contents against the wall or membrane
